Message:
I was going to remove
the seed from inside me.

That’s what I’d decided,
but as its roots were already
embedded inside me,
removal was already impossible.

But, its very impossibility is
what makes it worth the risk!

The teachers were sure to
oppose me if they knew,
so I pretended I was gonna
conduct an experiment to
read the seed’s memories.

Even cuttin’ into my sleep
left me with barely any time,
so I was forced to cut corners.

Makin’ concessions on my
potential survival felt
so frustratingly at odds
with the whole point,
it gave me a strange thrill.

Finally, it was the day
of the experiment.

At the teacher’s,
“I assume you’re fully
ready for this?”
I couldn’t answer.
After all, if I failed, I’d die.
I’d be dead, just like that.

I knew that from the start,
but only then did my legs
begin to shake.

Ahh... So dying was...
always supposed to feel
this scary, huh...?
